term.title: delayed coke

item.text: A commonly used term for a primary carbonization product (green or raw coke) from high-boiling hydrocarbon fractions (heavy residues of petroleum or coal processing) produced by the delayed coking process.

notes.item: Delayed coke has, with only a few exceptions, a better graphitizability than cokes produced by other coking processes even if the same feedstock is used. Delayed coke contains a mass fraction of volatile matter between 4 and 15 wt% which can be released during heat treatment.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 473. 'Recommended terminology for the description of carbon as a solid (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 486 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567030473)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
